seeAlso__genre__footer: Michael Jackson  and Madonna , known respectively as the "King and Queen of Pop" since the 1980s.
seeAlso__genre__quote: The story of pop music is largely the story of the intertwining pop culture of the United States and the United Kingdom in the postwar era.
A good definition of rock, in fact, is that it's popular music that to a certain degree doesn't care if it's popular.

Rock and roll was conceived as an outlet for adolescent yearnings ... To make rock and roll is also an ideal way to explore intersections of sex, love, violence, and fun, to broadcast the delights and limitations of the regional, and to deal with the depredations and benefits of mass culture itself.

A strange time, 1971—although rock's balkanization into genres was well underway, it was often hard to tell one catch-phrase from the next. "Art-rock" could mean anything from the Velvets to the Moody Blues, and although Led Zeppelin was launched and Black Sabbath celebrated, "heavy metal" remained an amorphous concept.

seeAlso__spinoffs__quote: As I was asked to do a show in Berlin before John and I got together, I wanted to use four plastic stands with tape recorders in each one of them, as my band. I told that story to John, and he immediately coined the phrase PLASTIC ONO BAND.

"Within You Without You" by the Beatles, written by George Harrison, 1967.ogg
seeAlso__formerBandMember__restingPlace: Cremated; ashes scattered in Central Park, New York City
seeAlso__formerBandMember__quote: John is kinda like a constant ... always there in my being ... in my soul, so I always think of him".
Linda was a big fan of my guitar playing, whereas I've got my doubts. I think there are proper guitar players and then there are guys like me who love playing it.
I think there's an urge in us to stop the terrible fleetingness of time. Music. Paintings ... Try and capture one bloody moment please.
If I couldn't have any other instrument, I would have to have an acoustic guitar.
After Brian died ... Paul took over and supposedly led us you know ... we went round in circles ... We broke up then. That was the disintegration. I thought, 'we've fuckin' had it.'

I didn't really want to keep going as a solo artist ... so it became obvious that I had to get a band together ... Linda and I talked it through and it was like, "Yeah, but let's not put together a supergroup, let's go back to square one."

Paul is one of the most innovative bass players ... half the stuff that's going on now is directly ripped off from his Beatles period ... He's an egomaniac about everything else, but his bass playing he'd always been a bit coy about.

The type of people that I came from, I never saw better! [...] I mean, the Presidents, the Prime Minister, I never met anyone half as nice as some of the people I know from Liverpool who are nothing, who do nothing. They're not important or famous. But they are smart, like my dad was smart. I mean, people who can just cut through problems like a hot knife through butter. The kind of people you need in life. Salt of the earth.
seeAlso__formerBandMember__source: — McCartney on Presley, The Beatles Anthology, 2000
— Lennon, Playboy magazine published in January 1981
seeAlso__formerBandMember__crest: On a wreath of the colours a Liver Bird calling Sable supporting with the dexter claws a guitar Or stringed Sable.
seeAlso__formerBandMember__escutcheon: Or between two Flaunches fracted fesswise two roundels Sable over all six guitar strings palewise throughout counterchanged.

spouse__relatives__fields: Women's health, women's biology, leptin, obesity, fat, infertility, public health, population health, biology
spouse__quote: His marriage to Linda, viewed as such a disastrous misstep at the time, became by far the happiest and most durable in pop. Despite the immensity of his fame and wealth, the couple managed to lead a relatively normal domestic life and prevent their children from becoming the usual pampered, neglected, screwed-up rock-biz brats. If the public never quite warmed to Linda, thanks mainly to her militant vegetarianism and animal-rights activism, she was acknowledged to have been the right one for him, just as Yoko had been for John.

partner__partner__quote: John is kinda like a constant ... always there in my being ... in my soul, so I always think of him".
Linda was a big fan of my guitar playing, whereas I've got my doubts. I think there are proper guitar players and then there are guys like me who love playing it.
I think there's an urge in us to stop the terrible fleetingness of time. Music. Paintings ... Try and capture one bloody moment please.
If I couldn't have any other instrument, I would have to have an acoustic guitar.
After Brian died ... Paul took over and supposedly led us you know ... we went round in circles ... We broke up then. That was the disintegration. I thought, 'we've fuckin' had it.'

I didn't really want to keep going as a solo artist ... so it became obvious that I had to get a band together ... Linda and I talked it through and it was like, "Yeah, but let's not put together a supergroup, let's go back to square one."

Paul is one of the most innovative bass players ... half the stuff that's going on now is directly ripped off from his Beatles period ... He's an egomaniac about everything else, but his bass playing he'd always been a bit coy about.

The type of people that I came from, I never saw better! [...] I mean, the Presidents, the Prime Minister, I never met anyone half as nice as some of the people I know from Liverpool who are nothing, who do nothing. They're not important or famous. But they are smart, like my dad was smart. I mean, people who can just cut through problems like a hot knife through butter. The kind of people you need in life. Salt of the earth.
partner__partner__source: — McCartney on Presley, The Beatles Anthology, 2000
— Lennon, Playboy magazine published in January 1981
partner__partner__crest: On a wreath of the colours a Liver Bird calling Sable supporting with the dexter claws a guitar Or stringed Sable.
partner__partner__escutcheon: Or between two Flaunches fracted fesswise two roundels Sable over all six guitar strings palewise throughout counterchanged.

His marriage to Linda, viewed as such a disastrous misstep at the time, became by far the happiest and most durable in pop. Despite the immensity of his fame and wealth, the couple managed to lead a relatively normal domestic life and prevent their children from becoming the usual pampered, neglected, screwed-up rock-biz brats. If the public never quite warmed to Linda, thanks mainly to her militant vegetarianism and animal-rights activism, she was acknowledged to have been the right one for him, just as Yoko had been for John.

child__instrument__footer: Notations used for the sustain pedal in sheet music

Musical-instrument historians write that it is an error to consider "oriental lutes" as direct ancestors of the guitar, simply because they have the same body shape, or because they have a perceived etymological relationship . While examples with guitar-like incurved sides such as the instrument in the Airtam Frieze or the Hittite lute from Alacahöyük are known, there are no intermediary instruments or traditions between those instruments and the guitar.

Similarly, musicologists have argued over whether instruments indigenous to Europe could have led to the guitar. This idea has not gotten beyond speculation and needs "a thorough study of morphology and performing practice" by ethnomusicologists.
Triple Neck  and Double Neck  Guitars.

child__genre__quote: A good definition of rock, in fact, is that it's popular music that to a certain degree doesn't care if it's popular.

Rock and roll was conceived as an outlet for adolescent yearnings ... To make rock and roll is also an ideal way to explore intersections of sex, love, violence, and fun, to broadcast the delights and limitations of the regional, and to deal with the depredations and benefits of mass culture itself.

A strange time, 1971—although rock's balkanization into genres was well underway, it was often hard to tell one catch-phrase from the next. "Art-rock" could mean anything from the Velvets to the Moody Blues, and although Led Zeppelin was launched and Black Sabbath celebrated, "heavy metal" remained an amorphous concept.
child__associatedMusicalArtist__quote: John is kinda like a constant ... always there in my being ... in my soul, so I always think of him".
Linda was a big fan of my guitar playing, whereas I've got my doubts. I think there are proper guitar players and then there are guys like me who love playing it.
I think there's an urge in us to stop the terrible fleetingness of time. Music. Paintings ... Try and capture one bloody moment please.
If I couldn't have any other instrument, I would have to have an acoustic guitar.
After Brian died ... Paul took over and supposedly led us you know ... we went round in circles ... We broke up then. That was the disintegration. I thought, 'we've fuckin' had it.'

I didn't really want to keep going as a solo artist ... so it became obvious that I had to get a band together ... Linda and I talked it through and it was like, "Yeah, but let's not put together a supergroup, let's go back to square one."

Paul is one of the most innovative bass players ... half the stuff that's going on now is directly ripped off from his Beatles period ... He's an egomaniac about everything else, but his bass playing he'd always been a bit coy about.

The type of people that I came from, I never saw better! [...] I mean, the Presidents, the Prime Minister, I never met anyone half as nice as some of the people I know from Liverpool who are nothing, who do nothing. They're not important or famous. But they are smart, like my dad was smart. I mean, people who can just cut through problems like a hot knife through butter. The kind of people you need in life. Salt of the earth.

child__associatedBand__escutcheon: Or between two Flaunches fracted fesswise two roundels Sable over all six guitar strings palewise throughout counterchanged.
